docs.title: About Me
docs.text: Hi! My name is Wen-hung Chou. I am a computational biologist focusing on spatial biology applications in cancer research.

docs.title: What I Do
docs.text: My work involves computational analysis of spatial transcriptomics, spatial proteomics, and fluorescence microscopy images.

docs.title: Recent Projects
docs.text:
• Bone marrow microenvironment changes with aging and cancer
  • 3D morphological changes from precancer to cancer
  • Assembly mechanisms of myosin clusters in adherent cells

docs.title: Current Research Projects
docs.text: Here are some of my key research projects in computational biology with a focus on spatial biology applications in cancer research.

docs.title: Myosin Cluster Assembly in Adherent Cells
